description: Number of (3,n)-partitions of a chain of length n^2.
comments: a (k,n)-partition of a chain C is a chain of k intervals of C of length n.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (7,-21,35,-35,21,-7,1).
example: a(3)=1 because in the linearly ordered set {1,..,9} we can choose in just one way 3 successive blocks of 3 consecutive elements.
author: Paolo Dominici (pl.dm(AT)libero.it), Jun 07 2000
